info.headline: Flood Warning issued July 13 at 8:11AM CDT until July 16 at 11:06PM CDT by NWS San Angelo TX
info.description:
...The Flood Warning is extended for the following rivers in Texas...
San Saba River At San Saba affecting San Saba County.
For the San Saba River...including Menard, San Saba...Moderate flooding is forecast.
* WHAT...Moderate flooding is forecast.
* WHERE...San Saba River at San Saba.
* WHEN...From this afternoon to late Wednesday evening.
* IMPACTS...At 27.0 feet, Moderate lowland flooding will occur. Secondary roads and low water crossings will be flooded.
* ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 7:00 AM CDT Sunday the stage was 10.1 feet. - Bankfull stage is 20.0 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise above flood stage this afternoon to a crest of 30.5 feet tomorrow morning. It will then fall below flood stage late Wednesday morning. - Flood stage is 24.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 31.0 feet on 09/13/1952. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction:
Turn around, don't drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas.
Additional information is available at www.weather.gov.
The next statement will be issued this evening at 815 PM CDT.

parameter.value: FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT FROM THIS AFTERNOON TO LATE WEDNESDAY EVENING
